com.example.lunchmeet.lunchmeet

Class MapsActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • FragmentActivity
      • com.example.lunchmeet.lunchmeet.MapsActivity

  • public class MapsActivity
extends FragmentActivity
    The Default MapActivity class. Displays a map of the user's location and the surrounding area using the Google Maps API. The map is shown upon the user successfully logging into the app via Facebook. From here, the user can choose to invite others to their group, join a group, or create a group.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapsActivity

        public MapsActivity()

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Sets up the map and user/database instances so they can be used. Called upon starting the maps activity. Also takes care of location permissions: if the user has not permitted the app to access their location, they will be prompted to do so before being able to access any of the map features.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - saved activity state, null upon first starting the activity

      • checkLocationPermissions

        public void checkLocationPermissions()
        Checks if the user has granted location permission to the app. If they have not, the user will be prompted to grant this permission so that the app can use GPS to track their location.

      • setUpLocationRequest

        public void setUpLocationRequest()
        Sets up location request using Google Play Services in order to track the user's location continuously through GPS. Upon obtaining an initial location for the user, it sets up a marker to display their location + info on the map.

      • onRequestPermissionsResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsResult(int requestCode,
                                       java.lang.String[] permissions,
                                       int[] grantResults)
        Takes the appropriate actions based on whether the user granted location permissions to the app or not. If the permission was granted, set up the Google Play Services location request to use GPS tracking. Otherwise, don't allow the user to see the map actions.
        Parameters:
        requestCode - the permission the user granted/denied
        permissions - list of permissions needed
        grantResults - which permissions were granted

      • onMapReady

        public void onMapReady(GoogleMap googleMap)
        Sets up the map once available. The map is obtained through Google Maps API. This callback is triggered when the map is ready to be used. If Google Play services is not installed on the device, the user will be prompted to install it inside the SupportMapFragment. This method will only be triggered once the user has installed Google Play services and returned to the app. Sets a listener to display a user's photo + info when their marker is clicked.
        Parameters:
        googleMap - the google map

      • updateMap

        public void updateMap(double lat,
                      double lon)
        Update the map based on the user's new location.
        Parameters:
        lat - user's new latitude
        lon - user's new longitude

      • createMarker

        public Marker createMarker(LatLng currLoc)
        Create markers for the user and count of how many people are in their group (if any). Markers are created using bitmaps.
        Parameters:
        currLoc - the current location of the user
        Returns:
        the marker of the user's current location

      • onLocationChanged

        public void onLocationChanged(android.location.Location location)
        Called when the user's location changes based on the location tracked from the phone GPS. Calls the updateMap() method to show the user's new location on the map.
        Parameters:
        location - user's new location

      • onConnected

        public void onConnected(android.os.Bundle bundle)
        Called upon the app connecting to Google Play Services. Once this happens, checks that the user has granted location permissions to the app.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the application state

      • onConnectionSuspended

        public void onConnectionSuspended(int i)
        On connection suspended.
        Parameters:
        i - the suspended code

      • onConnectionFailed

        public void onConnectionFailed(ConnectionResult connectionResult)
        On connection failed.
        Parameters:
        connectionResult - the connection result

      • onStart

        protected void onStart()
        On start.

      • onStop

        protected void onStop()
        On stop.
